name: impatience
content:

C2 the feeling of being annoyed by someone's mistakes or because you have to wait: "I've shown you how to do this before," she said, unable to disguise her impatience.impatience with There's a growing impatience among the electorate with the old two-party system.

C2 the feeling of wanting something to happen as soon as possible: [ + to infinitive ] He was already half an hour late, which explains his impatience to leave.
